get-business-user-userId.docs:
### GET Business User

`/business/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Business User entity](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#user).

Calling `GET /business/user/{userId}` will return the entire User payload and rule execution results for the User with the corresponding `userId`

get-consumer-transaction.docs:
### GET Transactions

`/transactions` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Transaction entity](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#transaction).

Calling `GET /transactions/{transactionId}` will return the entire transaction payload and rule execution results for the transaction with the corresponding `transactionId`

executedRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
executedRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

hitRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
hitRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

get-consumer-user.docs:
### GET Consumer User

`/consumer/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Consumer User entity](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#user).

Calling `GET /consumer/user/{userId}` will return the entire user payload and rule execution results for the user with the corresponding `userId`

post-business-user.docs:
## POST Business User

`/business/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Business user entity.](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#user)

In order to pass the payload of a User to Flagright and verify the User, you will need to call this endpoint with the User payload. Not all fields are mandatory, you will only need to pass in the fields that you have and are relevant for your compliance setup.

### Payload


Each consumer Business entity needs three mandatory fields:

* `userId` - Unique identifier for the user
* `legalEntity` - Details of the business legal entity (CompanyGeneralDetails, FinancialDetails etc) - only `legalName`in `CompanyGeneralDetails` is mandatory
* `createdTimestamp` - UNIX timestamp in *milliseconds* for when the User is created in your system

executedRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
executedRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

hitRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
hitRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

post-business-user-event.docs:
## POST Business User Events

`/events/business/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the Business User Events entity.

User events are created after the initial `POST /business/users` call (which creates a user) and are used to:

* Update the STATE and KYC Status of the user, using the `userStateDetails` or `kycStatusDetails` field
* Update the user details, using the `updatedBusinessUserAttributes` field.

> If you have neither of the above two use cases, you do not need to use user events. 

### Payload

Each user event needs three mandatory fields:

* `timestamp`- the timestamp of when the event was created or occured in your system
* `userId` - The ID of the transaction for which this event is generated. 

In order to make individual events retrievable, you also need to pass in a unique `eventId` to the request body.

reason.docs: Reason for the event or a state change

userId.docs: Transaction ID the event pertains to

post-consumer-transaction.docs:
## POST Transactions

`/transactions` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Transaction entity.](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#transaction)

In order to pass the payload of a transaction to Flagright and verify the transaciton, you will need to call this endpoint with the transaction payload. Not all fields are mandatory, you will only need to pass in the fields that you have and are relevant for your compliance setup. 


### Payload

Here are some of the most used payload fields explained (you can find the full payload [schema below](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/87742ed31b30e-verify-a-transaction#request-body) with 1 line descriptions):

* `type`: Type of transaction (Ex: `WITHDRAWAL`, `DEPOSIT`, `TRANSFER` etc). 
* `transactionId` - Unique Identifier for the transaction. Flagright API will generate a `transactionId` if this field is left empty
* `timestamp` - UNIX timestamp in *milliseconds* of when the transaction took place
* `transactionState` - The state of the transaction, set to `CREATED` by default. [More details here](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships-in-the-api#transaction-lifecycle-through-transaction-events)
* `originUserId` - Unique identifier (if any) of the user who is sending the money. This user must be created within the Flagright system before using the [create a consumer user](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/18132cd454603-create-a-consumer-user) or [create a business user](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/f651463db29d8-create-a-business-user) endpoint
* `destinationUserId` - Unique identifier (if any) of the user who is receiving the money. This user must be created within the Flagright system before using the [create a consumer user](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/18132cd454603-create-a-consumer-user) or [create a business user](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/f651463db29d8-create-a-business-user) endpoint
* `originAmountDetails` - Details of the amount being sent from the origin
* `destinationAmountDetails` - Details of the amount being received at the destination
* `originPaymentDetails` - Payment details (if any) used at the origin (ex: `CARD`, `IBAN`, `WALLET` etc). You can click on the dropdown next to the field in the schema below to view all supported payment types.
* `destinationPaymentDetails` - Payment details (if any) used at the destination (ex: `CARD`, `IBAN`, `WALLET` etc). You can click on the dropdown next to the field in the schema below to view all supported payment types.

executedRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
executedRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

hitRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
hitRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

validateDestinationUserId.docs: Boolean string whether Flagright should validate if provided destinationUserId exist. True by default

validateOriginUserId.docs: Boolean string whether Flagright should validate if provided originUserId exist. True by default

post-consumer-user.docs:
## POST Consumer User

`/consumer/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Consumer user entity.](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#user)

In order to pass the payload of a User to Flagright and verify the User, you will need to call this endpoint with the User payload. Not all fields are mandatory, you will only need to pass in the fields that you have and are relevant for your compliance setup.

### Payload

Each consumer User entity needs three mandatory fields:

* `userId` - Unique identifier for the user
* `createdTimestamp` - UNIX timestamp in *milliseconds* for when the User is created in your system

executedRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
executedRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

hitRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
hitRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

post-transaction-event.docs:
## POST Transaction Events

`/events/transaction` endpoint allows you to operate on the [Transaction Events entity.](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#transaction-event)

Transaction events are created after the initial `POST /transactions` call (which creates a transaction) and are used to:

* Update the STATE of the transaction, using the `transactionState` field and manage the [Transaction Lifecycle](https://docs.flagright.com/docs/flagright-api/8c06ae6a3231a-entities-and-relationships#transaction-lifecycle-through-transaction-events)
* Update the transaction details, using the `updatedTransactionAttributes` field.

> If you have neither of the above two use cases, you do not need to use transaction events. 

### Payload

Each transaction event needs three mandatory fields:

* `transactionState` - STATE of the transaction -> value is set to `CREATED` after `POST /transactions` call
* `timestamp`- the timestamp of when the event was created or occured in your system
* `transactionId` - The ID of the transaction for which this event is generated. 

In order to make individual events retrievable, you also need to pass in a unique `eventId` to the request body.

executedRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
executedRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

hitRules.ruleDescription: If a user makes a remittance transaction >= 1800 in EUR - ask for proof of funds
hitRules.ruleName: Proof of funds for high value transactions

reason.docs: Reason for the event or a state change

transactionId.docs: Transaction ID the event pertains to

post-user-event.docs:
## POST Consumer User Events

`/events/consumer/user` endpoint allows you to operate on the Consumer User Events entity.

User events are created after the initial `POST /consumer/users` call (which creates a user) and are used to:

* Update the STATE and KYC Status of the user, using the `userStateDetails` or `kycStatusDetails` field
* Update the user details, using the `updatedConsumerUserAttributes` field.

> If you have neither of the above two use cases, you do not need to use user events. 

### Payload

Each user event needs three mandatory fields:

* `timestamp`- the timestamp of when the event was created or occured in your system
* `userId` - The ID of the transaction for which this event is generated. 

In order to make individual events retrievable, you also need to pass in a unique `eventId` to the request body.

reason.docs: Reason for the event or a state change

userId.docs: Transaction ID the event pertains to

accountNumber.docs: Bank account number of the individual

ACHPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

addressLines.docs: Address lines of the user's residence address

city.docs: City of the user's residence address

postcode.docs: Post code of the user's residence address

state.docs: State of the user's residence address

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

BusinessBase.docs: Model for a business user base fields

createdTimestamp.docs: Timestamp when the user was created

userId.docs: Unique user ID for the user

BusinessOptional.docs: Model for a business user - optional fields

directors.docs: Director(s) of the company. Must be at least one

shareHolders.docs: Shareholders (beneficiaries) of the company that hold at least 25% ownership. Can be another company or an individual

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

BusinessUsersResponse.docs: Model for business user risk score response

userId.docs: user ID the risk score pertains to

BusinessWithRulesResult.docs: Model for business payload with rules result

CardDetails.docs: Model for credit or debit card details

3dsDone.docs: Whether 3ds was successfully enforced for the transaction
3dsDone.name: _3dsDone

cardFingerprint.docs: Unique card fingerprint that helps identify a specific card without having to use explicit card number. This is likely available at your card payment scheme provider

CardPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

caseStatus.docs: Status of a case. E.g. Open, Closed etc.

caseStatusReason.docs: Case status reason. E.g. Closed & False Positive, Closed & Investigation Completed etc.

eventId.docs: Event ID the case pertains to

transactionId.docs: Transaction ID the case pertains to

userId.docs: User ID the case pertains to

CaseManagementEventCaseStatus.docs: Status of a case. E.g. Open, Closed etc.

CaseManagementEventCaseStatusReason.docs: Case status reason. E.g. Closed & False Positive, Closed & Investigation Completed etc.

CheckPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

CompanyFinancialDetails.docs: Model for business user company financial details

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

CompanyGeneralDetails.docs: Model for business user company general details

businessIndustry.docs: The industry the business operates in for a business customer

mainProductsServicesSold.docs: The key products and services provided by the company

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

CompanyRegistrationDetails.docs: Model for business user company registration details

legalEntityType.docs: Type of legal entity. Ex: Limited Liability

registrationIdentifier.docs: Commercial registry registration number for the company in its registration country

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

taxIdentifier.docs: Tax ID number of the registered entity

ConsumerName.docs: Model for a generic consumer name

ConsumerUsersResponse.docs: Model for consumer user risk score response

userId.docs: user ID the risk score pertains to

ContactDetails.docs: Model for business user contact information details

contactNumbers.docs: Phone numbers to contact a given business customer

emailIds.docs: Email addresses of the contacts for a given business customer

faxNumbers.docs: Fax numbers to contact a business customer

appVersion.docs: The version of the app your user is using on their device at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

batteryLevel.docs: Battery level of the device used for a transaction or event at a given timestamp

deviceLatitude.docs: Device latitude at a give timestamp for an event or transaction

deviceLongitude.docs: Device longitude at a give timestamp for an event or transaction

deviceMaker.docs: The maker of the device at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

deviceModel.docs: The model of the device at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

deviceYear.docs: The year the device was manufactured at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

ipAddress.docs: IP address of the device at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

operatingSystem.docs: Operating system of the device at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

vpnUsed.docs: Whether VPN was used at a given timestamp for an event or transaction

ExecutedRulesResult.docs: Model for list of executed rules

FailedRulesResult.docs: Model for list of rules failed execution. It means rules could not be run

GeneralBankAccountPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

GenericBankAccountDetails.docs: Model for any generic bank account

accountType.docs: Bank account type. E.g. Checking, Savings etc.

bankCode.docs: Unique identifier of the bank. In some countries, this can be the same as the bank's SWIFT code

specialInstructions.docs: Special instructions to be specified if any

HitRulesDetails.docs: Model for list of hit rules

BIC.docs: Identifier for the bank. Can be routing number, BIK number, SWIFT code, BIC number etc.

IBAN.docs: Account number of the user. Can be account number, IBAN number etc.

bankBranchCode.docs: Branch code of the bank. In some countries, this can be the same as the bank's SWIFT code

name.docs: Name of the bank account holder

IBANPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

LegalDocument.docs: LegalDocument model generalizes User's identity document type (ex: Passport)

documentExpirationDate.docs: User's identity document expiration date (UNIX timestamp in milliseconds)

documentIssuedDate.docs: User's identity document issuance date (UNIX timestamp in milliseconds)

documentNumber.docs: User's unique identity document number such as passport number

documentType.docs: User's identity document type such as passport, national ID etc.

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

LegalEntity.docs: Model for business user legal entity details

reasonForAccountOpening.docs: Reason for opening the account at financial institution

ListData.docs: Payload of a list, new or existed

phoneNumber.docs: Contact Number of the account holder

MpesaPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

Person.docs: Model for a generic individual - different from User model by not having userId field

legalDocuments.docs: User's legal identity documents - See Document Model for details

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

userId.docs: user ID the risk score pertains to
user ID the risk score pertains to

RiskScoringResult.docs: Model for results from Risk Scoring

RuleAction.docs: Model for rule action if a rule is hit. This is returned in the API response and can be configured on Console by operational accounts like a Compliance Analyst

RuleHitMeta.docs: Details of rule execution, for internal purposes only

accountType.docs: Account type. E.g. Checking, Savings etc.

swiftCode.docs: SWIFT code of the financial institution

SWIFTPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

Tag.docs: Generic key-value pair model to append a custom variable being sent to Flagright API

key.docs: Key value when you are creating a custom variable

value.docs: Value for a given key when you are creating a custom variable

destinationUserId.docs: UserId for transaction's destination. In other words, where the value is being transferred to.

originUserId.docs: UserId for where the transaction originates from

timestamp.docs: Timestamp of when transaction took place

TransactionLimits.docs: Model for transaction limits for a given user

transactionId.docs: Transaction ID that the results pertain to

TransactionState.docs: Model for transaction states. E.g. Processing, Refunded, Successful etc.

destinationPaymentDetails.docs: Payment details of the destination. It can be a bank account number, wallet ID, card fingerprint etc.

originPaymentDetails.docs: Payment details of the origin. It can be a bank account number, wallet ID, card fingerprint etc.

productType.docs: Type of produce being used by the consumer (ex wallets, payments etc)

promotionCodeUsed.docs: Whether a promotion code was used or not the transaction

reference.docs: Reference field for the transaction indicating the purpose of the transaction etc.

relatedTransactionIds.docs: IDs of transactions related to this transaction. Ex: refund, split bills

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

TransactionUpdatableDestinationPaymentDe.docs: Payment details of the destination. It can be a bank account number, wallet ID, card fingerprint etc.

TransactionUpdatableOriginPaymentDetails.docs: Payment details of the origin. It can be a bank account number, wallet ID, card fingerprint etc.

TransactionWithRulesResult.docs: Model for transaction payload with rules result

UPIPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

UserDetails.docs: Model for consumer user personal details

dateOfBirth.docs: Date of birth of the user (YYYY-MM-DD)

gender.docs: Gender of the individual - Male, Female or Non-Binary

UserDetailsGender.docs: Gender of the individual - Male, Female or Non-Binary

userId.docs: User ID that the results pertain to

legalDocuments.docs: User's legal identity documents - See Document Model for details

tags.docs: Additional information that can be added via tags

UserWithRulesResult.docs: Model for consumer user payload with rules result

WalletDetails.docs: Standardized model for a Generic wallet transaction

name.docs: Name of the account holder for a specific wallet

walletPhoneNumber.docs: Phone number associated with the wallet, if any

walletType.docs: Wallet type if there are various types of wallets belonging to the same user. E.g. Checking, savings, vault, different currency wallets etc.

WalletPaymentMethod.docs: Classify the method of payment as

rootApiFile.rawContents:
name: api
error-discrimination:
  strategy: status-code
display-name: Flagright API
environments:
  Default: https://sandbox.api.flagright.com
default-environment: Default
auth-schemes:
  x-api-key:
    header: x-api-key
    name: apiKey
    type: string
auth: x-api-key
